info.title: FeatureClient
info.description: Azure Feature Exposure Control (AFEC) provides a mechanism for the resource providers to control feature exposure to users. Resource providers typically use this mechanism to provide public/private preview for new features prior to making them generally available. Users need to explicitly register for AFEC features to get access to such functionality.

get.description: Gets all the preview features in a provider namespace that are available through AFEC for the subscription.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider for getting features.

200.description: OK - Returns an array containing metadata for each feature in the resource provider. The metadata includes the name of the feature, the registration state, the resource ID, and resource type.

state.description: The registration state of the feature for the subscription.

id.description: The resource ID of the feature.

type.description: The resource type of the feature.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.
